author: lpmaho
title: MLabs - Cardano-Tx-Lib for web3
description: The web3.js libraries for Ethereum support transaction creation in the browser, but similar libraries have yet to come to Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem is well presented in this section showing the great necessity of this project, they also talk about the targeted users and how they can benefit from this project in a short description. However, the description of the solution is not enough for the clearest picture on this project, they need to cover the main functions of the intended libraries and explain any possible differences compared to the previous one on Ethereum.
To answer how their proposal addresses the challenge, they explain how this practice will help Cardano and also compare their technology with the existing one on Etherum to help readers grab better their intention and the expected results of this project. The risks are well predicted and they also noted that they are in the addressing process, but it would be convincing if they give a summary of how they can deal with the challenges
f6_assessments.q1:

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal provided a context of the necessity of executing this project to improve some aspects of the Cardano ecosystem that are not preferable to the developers and users. The proposer suggested browser-based support to enhance users' experience. And this is quite good to convince that this project is, to some extent, in accordance with a part of the challenge expected, finding support structures to attract developers, users to engage in Cardano. The proposer provided details about the functions, and some main features of the product. This product is a series of transaction-building libraries allowing developers to mix and match tools to streamline transaction creation and maintenance for browser-based wallets, to build transactions to meet the requirements of a smart contract while balancing transactions. The proposal mentioned the outcome of this project, but it did not conclude how it contributes to the whole development of the Cardano ecosystem.The proposal pointed out two challenges that this project may face and noted that some solutions for them were found. However, the detail of solutions in terms of the technical aspect was not given. Therefore, it would be better if the proposal added more information about how to solve those issues or mitigate potential risks.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal provided an overview of how the project will be executed. However, it could be improved by adding more details in the timeline outlining all milestones that the project will experience from the beginning to the end.This section of the proposal also included information about the functions that users could receive, which is supposed to be mentioned in the Impact section instead to show how suitable it is to the given challenge. A detailed cost breakdown in time needed for a certain activity was well-written. The proposal proved the high feasibility of this project by showing that this project is handled by MLabs which is one of the leading development firms in Cardano with many experienced developers. The firm also launched several projects with the reference link to their website, so they will have a lot of experience to ensure the success of this project. Another highlight here is that their core team includes many talented developers with profound knowledge and expertise in the field of software development, writing Python/Cython code, blockchain development, which is a big advantage for the firm to operate this project successfully. The link of their staff was also provided for reference. There is just one minor point that could be improved in this proposal is that if it mentions this is their full team needed or they still need to hire a number of staff, then everything would be clearer.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal mentioned how impactful it is to operate this project, which is supposed to include in the Impact section. In fact, it lacked detailed measurable indicators for each period of the project to show how the project proceeds and its status of the operation. It is better to add more figures in the KPI sector to make it clearer and more specific. However, it mentioned some factors to audit, track, and trace the process of executing the project through those mentioned criteria. Besides, this project did a great job in listing specific work results in different courses of time and indicated this is a new project that has not been funded before

f6_assessments.q0:
The proponent addressed the challenge by attempting to resolve a flaw in the Cardano model's design: the difficulty in constructing transactions and the requirement to integrate into the effect system of the off-chain contract monad. Their approach is to create a library that would provide browser-based support for transactions, making it simple and straightforward for developers to integrate into crucial infrastructure. This proposal's purpose is nicely matched with the challenge, which is to provide a favorable developer experience and attract developers to the ecosystem. The idea demonstrated that the author had carefully considered their solution. They investigated the advantages that Ethereum offers in terms of user experience that Cardano does not, and then devised a thoughtful solution to bridge this gap.

The proponent had expected obstacles in the development process: dealing with type differences and resolving discrepancies in UTxO management among wallets. These technological concerns were resolved, and the proponent team made some early headway. As a result, I believe the project's delivery is at low risk.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proponent provided the goals of the project and an outline of how they would proceed to achieve the goals without a timeline. However, I later discovered in the Auditability part three milestones, which are three, six and twelve months, with reasonable achievements. So I considered that an acceptable plan. For clarity, I recommend that the proponent include the milestones in their delivery plan.

The budget breakdown is quite comprehensive. It includes major items in the development phase of the project, together with an estimated working time to complete each item. From my understanding, the proponent calculated the final budget based on the total time needed and the wage of $79.95/hour. I performed some wage research and discovered that the indicated pay rate is within the pay range for a Senior Software Engineer in the United States. As a result, I believe the proponent should provide additional evidence of the team's experience in order to make the needed budget more convincing. 

The team is from MLabs, one of the leading development businesses in the Cardano Ecosystem, so they do have credibility. The core team seems well-versed in PureScript and Haskell. They also have multiple contributions to the ecosystem. Overall, I believe the team is capable of delivering the proposal successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
According to the KPIs submitted by the proponent, the success of the proposal is determined by the number of transactions, the amount of off-chain development time saved, and the number of wallets supported. This corresponds to the key metrics of the challenge. 

The project is open-sourced on GitHub, so the development progress as well as potential issues can be monitored by the community. We may also track the fulfillment of the functional elements stated in the proposed plan, as well as the time required to complete each one. This will help manage the budget better since the budget was estimated based on working hours.

The project's success is divided into three stages. The proponent's short-term goal is to establish functionality in a single wallet. They will then develop more features, integrate them with other wallets, and give documentation and tutorials. This method of first ensuring stability and then expanding seems acceptable to me.

solution: We are building an SDK for making and balancing transactions for browser-based wallets (Nami) and javascript environments (server, mobile).
experience: Several experienced PureScript developers, advanced Haskell / Plutus programmers, and a team of engineers working to build out the Cardano ecosystem.
